content:
UT journalism instructor Bonnie Hufford was honored by the Society of

Professional Journalists East Tennessee chapter Saturday evening in the

sixteenth annual  at the Knoxville Hilton PERIOD

SPJ Chapter President Suzanne Foree Neal said Hufford was recognized for

fostering the next generation of journalists PERIOD

Hufford has worked with journalism students on the high school and

collegiate level PERIOD Not only does Hufford teach journalism classes at UT

she also instructs local high school students through the Tennessee High

School Press program PERIOD Hufford also advises to the SPJ PERIOD

This recognition is a great boost for Hufford at this time of her life PERIOD

 Hufford said PERIOD

Hufford attended Bowling Green State University and Ohio University PERIOD She

has been teaching for  years PERIOD

The  is a spin off of the Washington Gridiron Press

Corp PERIOD event PERIOD  uses humorous skits and a popular

auction to raise money for journalism scholarships PERIOD

This years show featured a skit performed by Knox County Executive Dwight

Kessel called Farmers Market Deal PERIOD He was dressed in overalls and a straw

hat while handing out coupons to the farmers market PERIOD

Also performing for the crowd was Tim Burchett owner of Compost of

America PERIOD His skit was titled 

 said Neal PERIOD

Total proceeds have not been totaled at this time but the auction was

estimated to have brought in approximately  PERIOD Last years event raised

 PERIOD All proceeds from the  provide money for two journalism

scholarships to UT and one for Knoxville College PERIOD
